Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline; exterior: dot pattern at rim between brown lines; below, part of lotus bud, with possible trace of added red in centres, and lotus flower.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies this sherd as belonging to the group of vases with floral decoration in the Simple Animal Style. The lotus flower and lotus bud pattern found on these vessels appears on the exterior surface of the vases and in the later vases the pattern resembles that found on Fikellura vases.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 132, p. 307, no. 1257)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1003) (phase 2)
